document_data.name: Thayd
document_data.nicknames: Last Surviving Apprentice of the Imaskari
document_data.mainbody: '''Thayd''' was a wizard who led a rebellion against [[Mulhorand]] and [[Unther]] in {{yearlink|-1087}}.
document_data.History:
Thayd was known as the Last Surviving Apprentice of the Imaskari. Per the memories of the [[Pharaoh]] [[Ratep]], the wizard had learned much by studying the lore of the [[Imaskari]], which he shared with his followers.{{cite book/Old Empires|5}} He briefly seized the northern provinces of both empires.

In {{yearlink|-1081}}, He ensured that would be so by opening a portal to a savage world dominated by warmongering [[orcs]] on the same year, before his capture and execution for inciting fellow wizards to rebellion: after his death, no one in Faerun knew of the portal.
document_data.Rumors & Legends:
According to the ''[[Book of Ratep]]'', the Pharaoh believed that Imaskari lore had corrupted Thayd as it gave him power, and that the wizard would enslave the Mulan once more if left unchecked.

Per some sources, he let in hordes of orcs that would fight the Empires with a curse, rather than a portal.

Some sources suggest that Thayd may have endured beyond his death as an undead sentience attaching itself to the living to control them, destroying his host within the space of a few weeks.{{Cite web/Candlekeep forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2010)/Thayd}}<ref group="note">Better fix the Candlekeep Forum citations later. It is p80, not 70, though the thread seems to be in the right place.
